com.googlecode.cqengine.persistence.disk

Class DiskPersistence<O,A extends Comparable<A>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.cqengine.persistence.disk.DiskPersistence<O,A>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SQLitePersistence<O,A>, Persistence<O,A>

    public class DiskPersistence<O,A extends Comparable<A>>
extends Object
implements SQLitePersistence<O,A>
    Specifies that a collection or indexes should be persisted to a particular file on disk.

    Note on Concurrency
    Note this disk persistence implementation supports fully concurrent reads and writes by default. This is because it enables Write-Ahead Logging ("WAL") journal mode in the underlying SQLite database file by default (see that link for more details).

    Optionally, this class allows the application to override the journal mode or other settings in SQLite by supplying "override properties" to the onPrimaryKeyInFileWithProperties(SimpleAttribute, File, Properties) method. As WAL mode is suitable for most applications, most applications should work best with the default settings; the override support is intended for advanced or custom use cases.

    Author:
    niall.gallagher

      • expand

        public void expand(long numBytes)
        Description copied from interface: SQLitePersistence
        Expands the underlying persistence by the given number of bytes in a single operation. This will usually result in the persistence being expanded into an additional contiguous chunk of memory or region on disk.

        After this method returns, the operating system will report that the memory or disk space used for persistence has increased by this amount, but internally the space will simply be reserved for future use. The reserved space will be used to store objects added to the collection subsequently, without needing to request more memory from the OS ad-hoc.

        This can reduce fragmentation of the persistence file on some OS filesystems, especially if used prior to bulk imports when the persistence is on a non-SSD disk.

        Specified by:
        expand in interface SQLitePersistence<O,A extends Comparable<A>>

        public void openRequestScopeResources(QueryOptions queryOptions)

This allows the application to supply its own implementation of ConnectionManager to override the default if necessary.

      • onPrimaryKey

        public static <O,A extends Comparable<A>> DiskPersistence<O,A> onPrimaryKey(SimpleAttribute<O,A> primaryKeyAttribute)
        Creates a DiskPersistence object which persists to a temp file on disk. The exact temp file used can be determined by calling the getFile() method.
        Parameters:
        primaryKeyAttribute - An attribute which returns the primary key of objects in the collection

        A DiskPersistence object which persists to a temp file on disk
        See Also:
